reviewText: This DVD skillfully documents one of the most infamous incidents in Olympic history! Through interviews and background information, viewers can grow to better understand the humanity and passion which were the driving forces behind each runner's remarkable career.

Mary Decker was a running prodigy. It is amazing all the trials that she went through as a kid and was still able to compete at the highest level. I was Zola Budd got a little more attention in the story because she is just as amazing.

A well produced documentary about Mary Decker-Slaney, the American Sweetheart of running in the 1090's.  The film offers a well balanced look at her life.  Many of us still remember her as a courageous runner may have forgotten some of her great challenges as well as her shortcomings.  This documentary does not.
